717279f-a.text:
Broadway, north from Bleecker Street, showing prominently the Broadway Central Hotel on the west side of this thoroughfare, slightly to the south of West 3rd Street. In the distant background, at the point where this arterial causeway bends, is the shadowy outline of Grace Church.
About 1895
Gift of Urbrock Collection

724419f-a.text:
West Broadway, east side, north from but not including Bleecker Street, to and including Washington Square, North.
About 1905.
Brown Brothers.
724419f-a.folder: West Broadway & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

717277f.text:
N635-637 Broadway,West Side.,between Bleecker and
West Houston Streets.
November 7,th,1913.
Wurts Brothers,Photographers,
No Reproductions.
Neg. #5072

716688f-a.text:
144-6 Bleecker Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of West Broadway showing Mori's Restaurant, founded in 1884 by Placido Mori. These buildings were remodelled by Raymond Hood who also resided on Washington Square North, above the restaurant proprietors. This photo was reproduced on page 88 of the published volume "Changing New York."
November 21, 1935
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
716688f-a.folder: Bleecker Street & West Broadway., Manhattan, NY

724417f.text:
West Broadway, north from Bleecker Street, showing a track removal project under way. Overhead is the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.
December 7, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
724417f.folder: West Broadway & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

717278f-a.text:
P.L. Sperr collection
Rec'd January 13, 1945
Neg. No. 305

724416f-b.text:
West Broadway, north from the Bleecker Street platform of the Sixth Avenue Elevated line,to Washington Square. On the horizon, beyond that point appears the Metropolitan, New York Life and Chrysler Buildings. Note the westward bend on N. 3rd Street of this transportation line. Civic authorities at this time have filed notice of demolition for the complete Sixth Avenue Elevated line and same will shortly disappear from the Manhattan scene; its services being performed by the about to
be completed Sixth Avenue Municipal Subway.
May 23, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
The same thoroughfare subsequent to the 'E1' demolition. Note the distinctive apartment house, No. 1 Fifth Avenue, in the background. Washington Square intervenes between this
point and the end of this street.
May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
724416f-b.folder: West Broadway & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY
